newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican daily port, shipping update for March 4.
newsitem.headline: Mexican daily port, shipping update for March 4.

text.p: Mexican crude ports Pajaritos and Dos Bocas reopened early Tuesday as wind speeds declined in the Gulf of Mexico, the Communications and Transport Ministry said in its 1000 local/1600 GMT daily meteorological report.
The ports reopened at 0630 local/1230 GMT Tuesday as wind speeds fell to a maximum 20 km per hour, from about 45 km per hour. Both crude ports had closed Sunday afternoon.
Coatzacoalcos port was closed to smaller tourism and fishing boats, the ministry said.
The ministry updated port conditions and shipping warnings for the Gulf of Mexico, Caribbean and Pacific Coast.

Weak cold front moving east-southeast along Baja California peninsula, where winds 10 to 20 knots (19 to 38 km/11 to 22 miles per hour) and waves four to seven feet high. Warm weather and light winds along most of coast, with light rains along Oaxaca coast.
Cold front along northwestern gulf dissipated. Warmer termperatures and clear skies with strongest winds from 10 to 1 knots (19 to 28 km/11 to 17 miles per hour).
Hot and mostly clear skies, moderate east and southeast winds from 20 to 30 km per hour.
